attributes.action: Re-introduce permission to smoke at Psychiatric Hospitals.
attributes.background: This is to improve patient care, understanding, rapport building and compliance with treatment in this difficult setting. The introduction of a ban has led to many barriers in patient care and freedon of choice should be exercised.
attributes.additional_details: Staff and patients alike are now seeing that smoking, although detrimental to health is important for this group of people. It enables better compliance with treatment and allows patients to cope better. Smoking should be re-introduced in the grounds, designated smoking areas and smoking rooms on wards.

attributes.action: Short-termism is a real problem for the long-term good governance of the country
attributes.background: I propose a law that would be called the Posterity Law.  This law would create a rolling oversight agency that would audit the legislation after 4, 8, 12, 16 and 20 years.  If the original legislators were found to be short-termist then they would be penalised by both loss of liberty and wealth.
attributes.additional_details:
To implement this law there would have to be some changes to the Statute of Limitations.

The members of the Oversight Agency would be taken from the general population rather in the manner of Jury Service for short periods.  These members would judge the legislation by the standards of the time.  This would ensure that our elected representatives would consider posterity before enacting legislation.

Any short-termism, opportunism, side-lining of data or lies will be penalised.

attributes.action: Re-examine the 24 hour drinking laws which came into force in 2005.
attributes.background:
In 2005 24 hour drinking laws were established. The idea to create a continental café culture in the U.K has failed and it has turned Town Centres into binge drinking, hostile areas. 

Public services are overstretched and unable to cope effectively with the effects.
attributes.additional_details:
The Police, Ambulance and other public services spend a large portion of their time dealing with alcohol related incidents. A great deal of alcohol related incidents involve disorder, violence and injury. This therefore requires a number of services to deal with the fallout of alcohol abuse.

The effects of alcohol abuse are well documented and frequently attract media attention. It's time to taclean binge drinking culture and create a more sensible approach to alcohol consumption.

attributes.action: Trident never dismantled, Forever Nuclear deterrence only for the UK's defence.
attributes.background: We the signed would request the government to enshrine into law, that its the nations right and safety that Britain can never have their nuclear deterrence taken away by anyone or any group and forever maintained as a means of deterrence and national safety across the United Kingdom/Territories.
attributes.additional_details: Recently far left groups and leaders of parties have expressed their personal desire to remove the UKs nuclear arsenal and deterrence. Whilst they dream of this notion of 'if we dismantle, others will follow', This has never been the case and it is a matter of national security and defence that we maintain and enshrine that our nuclear deterrence is never taken away by any group or individual. One must wonder had Ukraine never dismantled would they be in the state they are today with Russia?

attributes.action: To establish a new bank holiday for the UK to be named "UK Diversity Day".
attributes.background: This day should be celebrated across the UK celebrating the contribution of the many diverse groups across a number of strands of UK society including Age, Disability, Gender, LGBT, Race and Religion. We are a great nation with a great history of embracing diversity and we should celebrate that.

attributes.action: Brexit negotiations to promote a strong & collaborative relationship with the EU
attributes.background: Sixteen million people voted to Remain. The views of these people and the weight of their opinion must be reflected in Brexit negotiations. The negotiation team must focus on forging a strong, collaborative and balanced working relationship with the EU, and be made up accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
I was vehemently for Remain, and now I am determined that Brexit is made to mean healthy collaboration with the EU on new terms (and terms that the Northern Ireland and Scotland can support as part of the UK) rather than a soapbox for nationalistic rhetoric!

Britain may have voted out, but it clearly and emphatically does not want away. Most importantly, Brexit does not (and will not) mean embracing the Farage and Le Pen view of the world!

It is hope the EU will help us make this happen.

attributes.action: Require large companies to pay invoices within 30 days of invoice date.
attributes.background: Large companies impose onerous payment periods on small companies. Small companies are unable to resist because of their lack of power. This results in large companies using small companies as another source of funding.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, to add a further level of difficulty, the large companies have created a charge mechanism for invoices paid in a lesser time. It is quite common for large companies to pay smaller companies in periods of 90 - 120  days.

attributes.action: RAISE Tariffs on IMPORTED steel to keep British Steel ALIVE.
attributes.background: Our manufacturing sector has been decimated over decades of neglect and a sense of simply not caring. A strong manufacturing sector constitutes a resilient, strong, diverse and booming economy. WE NEED MORE THAN JUST SERVICES. We can begin by raising tariffs on imported, cheap steel.
attributes.additional_details: Our Steel Industry has been decimated over the years by cheap Chinese and other low labour cost nation imports. LEVY IT. This will promote projects within the UK to use British Steel thus reviving the industry, producing jobs and a renewed sense of pride within ourselves. Moreover, to support and kick start this I want capital, state projects to ONLY use British Steel. Beginning with HS2 and other ongoing projects. I believe this will boost economic output and GDP and benefit us all immensely.

attributes.action: If 2nd referendum occurs, change rules. Give 16+ & expats ex uk 15 + yrs a vote.
attributes.background:
Before any new referendum Lower the voting age to 16
Allow expats out of the uk more than 15 years to have a vote
attributes.additional_details:
* The younger generation should be allowed to have a say on their own future. Not have it made for them by a much older generation.

* Expats like me, British passport , ex British army but lived in another member state, ( and have a business France for 16 years promoting and selling uk products ) were not allowed a say on such an important vote.

attributes.action: Create a TV advert explaining to people who voted remain how democracy works.
attributes.background: It has become clear since the referendum result was announced that a significant number of the population do not understand how the democratic process works. This is an issue which a skilfully crafted TV advert will help to address.

attributes.action: Improve the representation of the British people in the UK parliament.
attributes.background:
We ask that parliament gives the British people a yes/no referendum on this question by June 2019:

“Do you want the UK to have an elected second house to represent the regional needs of the British people and proportional representation in the House of Commons to form all future governments?
attributes.additional_details:
There has been a growing need for reform of our democratic system for the last few decades. 

We feel that this is needed to improve communication between the political elite and the British people and to make our democracy more representative of the full spectrum of the view points held by our citizens.

attributes.action: Make future UK referendum results require a majority of 60%
attributes.background: Referendums are called by the UK government on matters of major constitutional change. Any major change from the status quo should have the backing of at least 60% of those who vote in each referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Recent referendums have demonstrated the strongly devisive nature of proposed major changes to people's lives, especially when the result is close to an even split. Having to reach a qualified majority of 60% in any UK referendum would help ensure that changes are more widely accepted amongst the electorate.

attributes.action: For EU motions to be urgently debated in Parliament offering a range of outcomes
attributes.background: Next steps for Parliament is far from clear or defined in law. An urgent Commons debate should offer a range of motions from each side of the campaign with full analysis of issues and offering a range of options moving forward. Any parliamentary outcome should be accompanied by wider consultation.

attributes.action: UK must reaffirm its commitment of sovereignty over Gibraltar after Brexit
attributes.background: With Spain renewing its claim of sovereignty over Gibraltar in a matter hours after the UK voted to leave the European Union, the UK Government must immediately reaffirm its commitment to Gibraltar .
attributes.additional_details:
The UK must a make a binding treaty with the European Union guaranteeing Gibraltar special status, which guarantees visa free cross-border movement for people and trade between Gibraltar and Spain. 

The UK government must grant Gibraltar their own dedicated MP in parliament 

The UK must re-establish our permanent Army and Royal Navy bases on Gibraltar to guarantee its future security.

attributes.action: Block George Osborne's emergency budget proposal, if Britain leaves the EU
attributes.background: George Osborne has announced that if Britain leaves the EU, he will be forced to raise taxes and cut spending to prevent an economic meltdown. Not only is the 'evidence' used to suggest this just based on wild predictions and scaremongering, but it also contradicts the 2015 conservative manifesto.

attributes.action: Ensure the EU referendum goes ahead and we get our democratic right to decide.
attributes.background: I want to ensure the British people get their say on 23rd June as to whether we remain a part of the EU or not. A petition calling for the referendum to be cancelled and for the British government to make the decision (to stay in the EU) is circulating. Help ensure the democratic process happens.

attributes.action: Property buyers must be British citizens, not corporations or overseas investors
attributes.background: In a time that overpopulation and immigration are hot topics, we need to use the space we have to accommodate the people that make Britain great. In order for this to happen, we need to stop properties being able to be bought by anonymous foreign investors for their own economic gain.
attributes.additional_details: Over £120bn of British properties are owned by offshore companies, who don't pay the same taxes as us to the government, and often don't occupy the housing they own. The Standard revealed investors had bought at least £100 billion of property in the capital using overseas companies. The Land Registry figures also show that in just one deal signed off by Boris Johnson in 2011, at Riverlight Quay in the Nine Elms regeneration area, 15% of the homes sold so far have been bought by foreign firms.

attributes.action: No confidence in the Government's Naval Strategy
attributes.background:
The Government should increase the effectiveness of the Royal Navy by designing and building the fleet into a credible and efficient navy by reducing the colossal waste and inefficiency in defence procurement.
We need to change the Royal Navy into an effective navy that can be fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned via this petition wish to show our dismay with the Government’s naval strategy, caused by underfunding, resulting in new ships unfit for purpose, delays in building the Type 26 Frigate and overspends on other projects.
More money should be allocated to the naval budget by reducing the amount spent on foreign aid”

attributes.action: Public Inquiry and full disclosure of corrupt covert operations
attributes.background:
Request for:
- Public Inquiry
- Full disclosure of official files 
of crimes by State of Human Rights violations against innocent individuals and / or their families subjected to misuse of covert operations and secrets act (including removal of exclusion notices to the innocent person's file).
attributes.additional_details: A person or family to be placed under covert operations must be a threat to national security by government, law enforcement, secret and security organisation, such as espionage, serious crimes and terrorism.  An innocent person exercising their legal rights in any context that is to democratic laws / policy is not a threat to State. Neither should be subjected to misuse of covert operations and their Human Rights violated.  All records collated constitute criminal evidence by such contravention.

attributes.action: Introduce a 3 strike policy before benefits can be sanctioned.
attributes.background: The use of automatic benefit sanctions is littered with examples of hardship incurred to those being sanctioned. There is no evidence that automatic benefit sanctions "help" people into work. It takes time to find a job, however anybody can have an emergency which causes them to miss an appointment.
attributes.additional_details:
http://tfne.ws/1him6Lp - "Half of all DWP sanctions wrongly imposed"
http://bit.ly/1Yex8Tr - "Warning vulnerable families are being pushed into poverty by wrongly imposed benefit sanctions"
http://bit.ly/1TYFXki - "A list of completely ridiculous benefit sanctions people have experienced"

attributes.action: If Asia Bibi is executed we should 'cease trading' with Pakistan immediately.
attributes.background: Asia Bibi, a Christian, offered water to a Muslim woman. She refused as it had been handled by a 'dirty animal and dirty Christian'. She was found guilty of blasphemy and sentenced to death because she said 'Jesus may have a different viewpoint to Mohammed'.
attributes.additional_details: Daily Express 1 June 2016. Asia Bibi offered water to a Muslim woman who “I said ‘I think Jesus would have a different viewpoint to Mohammed’, the woman said ‘how dare you question the prophet, dirty animal’ and a 'dirty Christian'. She was found guilty by a Pakistan court of blasphemy and sentenced to death.This, by inference, is saying all Christians including our Queen as Head of Commonwealth and also Church of England is also. STOP trading, giving AID and eject from Commonwealth.

attributes.action: Allow electric skateboards on roads as long as there are safety precautions.
attributes.background: Electric skateboards are banned due to them being motorised, they should be allowed because they have low emissions, cause less congestion along with appropriate breaking to prevent accidents. They should be allowed as long as you have safety wear and the companies do appropriate government tests.
attributes.additional_details: Company tests should be top speed test whether it's greater then 25mph maybe, breaking speed test (how long it takes to break). All companies should supply safety wear such as a helmet and a pair of gloves, in the end if these are in place then the board would be just as safe as a bike if not more because the capped top speed. If any of the rules aren't followed by people then if seen by law enforcement they should have their board confiscated and fined £500

attributes.action: stop! the sale of fish tanks under 30 litres to stop fish suffering
attributes.background: the sale of fish tanks under 30 litres is harmful to fish as water parameters dont settle and also not enough room for fish to grow it is cruel to fish and should be stamped out across the whole of the uk pet shops are wrong to sell these tanks

attributes.action: Publish all UK accounts in regard to EU & the Commons debate & scrutinise them.
attributes.background:
To make an informed decision at the referendum
I need to see with immediate effect all the UK accounts & contractual documents in regard to the EEC/EU
This will include all monies etc going to or from the EU
AND
all monies etc given out in the UK listing exactly without exception all recipients.
attributes.additional_details:
The complete accounts & documents to be openly published on the Government website.
The EU have failed to openly publish their accounts for over 18 years
& report said money is lost in corruption.
I am sick of hearing both sides referring to reports that are not always independent.
A full open audit will expose the truth & facts.

Without this evidence
As with any contract unless I can read & consider the terms & conditions then I will refuse to sign it.
In this case I will Vote to Leave the EU.

attributes.action: Allow Gamaniel Josh Pensee to remain in the UK following notice of deportation
attributes.background: Gamaniel Josh Pensee is an accomplished amateur boxer who is due to be deported to his country of birth, he has no ties or means of living. Living in the UK since a child and boxing throughout, he is set to turn pro. The popular and friendly character inspires all, he is expecting his first child
attributes.additional_details: Gamaniel Josh Pensee is a 27 and soon to be father. He came to England with his mother aged 14 and believed he had permission to live here after his mother was granted indefinite leave to remain whilst he was still a child. It wasn’t until he tried to apply to University in his 20’s that he was made aware that his mother’s status had not automatically applied to him. After appointing a lawyer and adhering to bail conditions whilst he has sought to be granted the same status as his mother, he was suddenly detained on 13th April 2016. He was soon after issued with a notice of intention for his deportation

attributes.action: Compel Bookmakers to accept £100 wagers and ban closing accounts
attributes.background: Bookmakers are systematically closing accounts of any punter with even short term profits.this is totally contrary to them being licenced to accepting bets.A modest figure of £100 would hardly lay them open to nefarious acts but would equally give a fair deal.
attributes.additional_details: I am sure several thousands respondents will support this ,all with similar stories.

attributes.action: Stop job discrimination against returning British Citizens
attributes.background: Government Departments have subcontracted recruitment companies (E.g. Capita) to manage the recruitment on their behalf. Some of these companies do not put forward candidates who have no been living in the UK for the past 3 - 5 years. This excludes British Citizens from working in the UK.

attributes.action: To create a maximum working environment temperature.
attributes.background: Working in conditions that are too hot can become counter productive and can mean that staff cannot fully function and work to their best capacity.

attributes.action: Reform faith school's religious studies to follow the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
Faith schools are mostly run like other state schools. They have to follow the national curriculum except for religious studies, where they are free to only teach about their own religion.

The exclusion of other religions does not open students to other faiths and promotes ignorance.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/types-of-school/faith-schools

attributes.action: Ban GMO crops in the UK
attributes.background:
Ban GMO (Genetically Modified) Crops in the UK because of:
1. its influence on human health is questionable.
2. once any plant is introduced in the ecosystem it is almost impossible to eradicate it
3. Food label does not show GMO content
attributes.additional_details:
Ban GMO (Genetically Modified) Crops in the UK because of:
1. its influence on human health is questionable (see http://www.motherearthnews.com/natural-health/nutrition/gmo-safety-zmgz13amzsto.aspx)
2. once any plant is introduced in the ecosystem it is almost impossible to eradicate it
3. food is not labelled correctly - it is not shown if food does contain the GMOs
4. special pesticides are used to protect GMO crops and they are dangerous to humans and environment

attributes.action: stop means testing carers allowance
attributes.background: us carers work hard to support our friends and family with dissabilities and yet we get money deducted from esa child tax working tax if we claim carers this is wrong.its a small price the goverment pay to us and then they take it back from other means,its wrong!!!

attributes.action: Restrict the maximum working hours of NHS staff to avoid mistakes being made.
attributes.background: This petition calls for the creation of legislation which limits the working hours of health care professionals who make decisions which affect patient safety, with the aim of preventing mistakes due to tiredness. It should be similar to GB and EU rules which restrict working hours for drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
Working long hours can lead to tiredness, which in turn can lead to dangerous mistakes being made. This is the reason for the existence of both GB domestic and EU legislation which restricts the number of hours drivers can work for in a week, how long they can drive for without a break and how long their breaks must be.

As NHS staff are often in situations at work where making a mistake can have extremely serious affects on patients health, a safe legal limit to working hours should apply.

attributes.action: Make it so that gender segregation, within P.E at school, is no longer allowed.
attributes.background: School's have become accustomed to separating genders in P.E. This is understandable in contact sports, such as Rugby, but why should it be so in non-contact sports. Sign this petition so that gender segregation is a thing of the past!

attributes.action: Omit the requirement for a TV License in HM Forces Single Living Accommodation
attributes.background: At present all serving personnel in HM Forces Single Living Accommodation require a TV License. An exemption should be made for Forces personnel on HM establishments whom reside due to a duty move.
attributes.additional_details:
Many serving personnel temporarily reside at HM establishments throughout the week, thus require a TV License for two addresses. The one exemption to the rule is that a TV can be watched on a license for another address if the device is battery operated and not mains powered.  iaw http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one/for-your-home/armed-forces-personnel-aud7.
Serving personnel are requested to move frequently to temporary locations for training courses.

attributes.action: Create more apprenticeships in policing and security.
attributes.background: After trying everything i have found there are minimal opportunities to get an apprenticeship in that professional area due to regulation on overtime and budget cuts more apprenticeships should be created in the security and policing areas to give people the experience required.
attributes.additional_details: I have been told the police no longer offer work experience by members of their staff and the security industry do not seem to provide apprenticeships, i see this as wrong because at a job interview all they will want is experience and without an apprenticeship you do not have that and they will dismiss you and hire an experienced Candidate.

attributes.action: Enabled Payment for School Dinners with Child Care Vouchers
attributes.background: For a family with 2 children, school dinners cost in the region of £900 per year. With family costs rising rapidly and well ahead of wages, this is becoming increasingly unaffordable for many parents.
attributes.additional_details:
More than one in five children at some primary schools in England start their first and final years of primary school underweight, figures show.

Allowing school meals to be paid for with childcare vouchers would ease family costs and increase take-up rate.

Hence, we hereby petition the Government to make it possible to pay for School Dinners via the Child Care Vouchers scheme.

attributes.action: Race or Jump, not Both! Stop Equine Steeplechases
attributes.background: This petition has been created in light of the recent horse fatalities at Cheltenham and Aintree 2016. Equine steeplechases with high hurdles over long distances have significantly higher morbidity and mortality rates than flat races and should therefore be stopped

attributes.action: MP's and spouses/partners release tax returns from the date the are elected.
attributes.background: In the interests of complete transparency, the UK electorate need to know if elected officials and their spouses/partners have vested interests that help their decision making.
attributes.additional_details: From the date they are elected, all elected officials and their spouses/partners should be obligated to publish their tax returns.

attributes.action: Make the working week 4 days and the weekend 3 days.
attributes.background: I feel we work far too hard as it is and two days is a pitiful reward for five days graft. We should reward ourselves with a three day weekend. After all, life is for living, not working. I propose we add an extra hour in the day for work on the days we work, but take Friday as part of the weekend.

attributes.action: Force food companies to label ALL types of sugar on all packaging as SUGAR
attributes.background:
Regardless of how they sound, the following are all sugar:
Cane juice, Dehydrated cane juice, Cane juice solids, Cane juice crystals, Dextrin, Maltodextrin, Dextran, Barley malt, Beet sugar, Corn syrup, Carob syrup, Brown sugar, Date sugar, Malt syrup, Fruit juice, Fruit juice concentrate.
attributes.additional_details: One of the most common tricks is to distribute sugars among many ingredients so that sugars don‘t appear in the top three. For example, a manufacturer may use a combination of sucrose, high-fructose corn syrup, corn syrup solids, brown sugar, dextrose and other sugar ingredients to make sure none of them are present in large enough quantities to attain a top position on the ingredients list (remember, the ingredients are listed in order of their proportion in the food, common ingredients first !

attributes.action: The gov to look at LED in all of it's buildings to save up to 90% on energy!
attributes.background: The government is very wasteful in all of its buildings or is very slow in the uptake of LED technology (Lighting) by just changing a light bulb they could save 90% on electricity. It's a simple process and a quick win for the electorate..less money to energy companies & more for the NHS!
attributes.additional_details: LED lighting compared to conventional lighting not only saves on maintenance but also has a better quality of light and is better for the environment, a conventional light bulb is 48watts and an LED equivalent is 6watts..huge consumption saving. for every lightbulb you change you will save around £20 per year....imagine ALL bulbs changed...payback is normally 6 months on one of these bulbs.

attributes.action: Abolish corporation tax and impose a land value tax of 1%.
attributes.background: Corporation tax is as outdated as window tax. Only small and poor companies pay it, the big and rich companies do not. It is a pointless, optional tax that diverts brainpower away from constructive applications. Scrap it. A land value tax of 1% will bring in more money and cannot be dodged.
attributes.additional_details: Corporation tax dates from a time when the biggest enterprises were steel works and railways, not search engines and social networks. We should stop complaining about tax havens and become one.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of a famous woman on Parliament square.
attributes.background: Parliament Square has statues of famous men in history. There are many women of importance that have contributed to our democracy surely this should be reflected in our most important landmark. Example Emily Pankhurst helped give women the vote.

attributes.action: Increase benefits for people who receive "Contribution based Benefits
attributes.background: . I was appalled when I contacted DWP for help and was informed that the Bereavement Benefit I was in receipt of, was higher than what the Government say I can live on
attributes.additional_details:
As my husband  was of Pensionable age the under occupancy did not apply when he was alive???? However since his death DWP removed all my husbands benefits (I have worked for over 40 years) how could this be... They will only pay contribution JSA for 6 months (which was stopped shortly after my husband passed away. 
Therefore I was informed that I can apply for Bereavement Benefit of £112 per week. 
Out of the £112 I was expected to pay full rent £97.79 per week and C.Tax.
I finally received a letter confirming that I would be exempt from the Underoccupancy due to the sudden death of my husband. It will only apply for 12 months where after I am expected to pay for the Underoccupancy,  this is DISCRIMINATION towards age.

attributes.action: Law to change so credit agencies include private rental payments on credit files
attributes.background: There is a natural parallel between monthly rental and mortgage payments that should be recognised by c.r.a. Aiding (private rental)citizens to become home owners escaping the trap/insecurity of private rental aiding contentment optimism and happiness benefiting communities and our broader society.
attributes.additional_details: We have rented privately for 14 years, my partner a lecturer and I an artist. We have 2 children. We have paid our rent on time, in full every month of these 14 years. Each rental payment is a massive percentage of our monthly income, higher than a mortgage would demand. Still this has had no positive implication on our credit rating that has however been negatively impacted by any minimally late utility bill payments. All these years of paying excessive rental payments has only benefitted the landlords and has had no influence on our credit rating that may have allowed us to escape the trap we find ourselves in and find deserved consistency for our family.

attributes.action: Urge North Korea to pardon Otto Warmbier and free him from his 15 year sentence.
attributes.background: A 21 year old US student has been sentenced to 15 years hard labour for removing a political poster. This is a very harsh punishment for a small crime - the sentence may be politically motivated towards the US as tensions are high between the two countries.

attributes.action: Scrap the plan to bring in a tax on sugary drinks
attributes.background: The tax on sugary drinks announced by the Chancellor in the budget on 16/03/16 impinges on the rights of people to choose what they would like to consume and how to raise their children. This is an illiberal policy showcasing the worst excesses of big government intrusion into people's lives.
attributes.additional_details: Childhood obesity is a multi-faceted problem, caused by poor diet, a lack of exercise and a societal acceptance of weight gain. A tax on sugary drinks is unlikely to make any kind of impact on this problem, and is simply a headline grabbing measure. These taxes have been shown to be largely ineffective in the countries where they have been implemented, achieving only price rises in products that hit the poorest hardest.

attributes.action: Change the law so it's illegal for children under 16 to be outdoors after 9pm
attributes.background: The law should be changed so children under 16 are not allowed outdoors after 9pm this is the cause of most anti social behaviour most children hang around the streets drinking smoking vandalising and terrorising people this might help tackle the ongoing situation also with gang crime as well

attributes.action: Stop the proposed plans to extend the school day for secondary school students
attributes.background: The chancellor, George Osborne, is planning to keep "25% of secondary schools open past 15:30". This is inconsiderate to not only the students but also the staff. Staff unfortunately are already under strain from the current long day which often continues at home for marking and further planning.
attributes.additional_details: BBC News article about the 2016 budget - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-35819797

attributes.action: Make it the law for all UK eateries to sell gluten free & lowfat dairy free food
attributes.background: Only a small amount of cafés in the UK offer gluten free & dairy free food. Some offer vegan and vegatarian food. It would be great if it was the law for all cafés and restaurants in the UK to provide food for all dietary issues then this would lessen suffering of uk long-term health improving life
